text: Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia (Aleksandar Pavlov Karađorđević; 13 August 1924 – 12 May 2016) was the elder son of Prince Paul. His father served as Regent of Yugoslavia in the 1930s, and his wife, Princess Olga of Greece and Denmark. He was born in White Lodge, Richmond Park, Surrey. Alexander married Princess Maria Pia of Savoy, daughter of King Umberto II of Italy in 1955. Alexander and Maria Pia divorced in 1967. On 17 February 2008, Alexander said that he did not support the declaration of independence by Kosovo.Announcement of His Royal Highness Prince Aleksandar Pavlov Karageorgevich . Czipm.org. Retrieved on 27 July 2015. Alexander died on 12 May 2016 in Paris, aged 91.http://www.tanjug.rs/full-view.aspx?izb=245917 ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1924 births Category:2016 deaths Category:People from Surrey Category:Princes and princesses Category:Yugoslavian people
title: Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia (1924–2016)
